abstract: Pacific Investment Management, the world’s biggest bond fund, has seen assets under management exceed $1 trillion for the first time, underscoring investors’ appetite for yield and portfolio diversification.
snippet: Pacific Investment Management, the world’s biggest bond fund, has seen assets under management exceed $1 trillion for the first time, underscoring investors’ appetite for yield and portfolio diversification.
lead_paragraph: Pacific Investment Management, the world’s biggest bond fund, has seen assets under management exceed $1 trillion for the first time, underscoring investors’ appetite for yield and portfolio diversification, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Pimco Assets Under Management Pass $1 Trillion
